title: Perfect game 10/0/4 w Surrender. Only A Grade??? WTF?
body:
When i carry my team like crazy, going **10/0/4** by 20 mins, causing enemy to surrender, I only get an **A** grade.
When our support goes **5/1/7** never leaving bot lane, he gets an **S** grade...
I took way more objectives than he did (Dragon, Towers etc) and I had more gold at the end of the match, but his CS was higher... I'm not supposed to take CS. I'm supposed to gank for my gold, take objectives, and force an early surrender.

I'm currently lvl 6 mastery with Shaco, but getting an S just seems to only happen if I have a drawn out game, which is really undesireable for shaco, because at a certain point, he starts to drop behind others.

If I do my job properly, this game I just had is exactly what I am supposed to achieve as Shaco. Gank lanes, get kills, snowball lanes, and disrupt the enemy jungler enough that he wants to surrender.
I did all of that perfectly this game, but I still only get an A...

So basically, this stupid rating system, is asking me to go take CS from peoples lanes as well, so I can have a good CS score??
Or maybe get less kills so they dont surrender, and let the game drag out and HOPE the enemy doesn't catch up and eventually make me useless?

RIOT needs to make some adjustments to account more for a jungler's objectives. Because with a perfect game as Shaco, RIOT's rating system doesnt seem to think i did very well...

replies.body:
I think you're misunderstanding a few things, but there's definitely some truth to what you're saying :)



_Let me clear up something first:_

+ The rating system is based on **how well you did compared to other Shaco junglers**. 

 If your stats show you're in the top percentage of **Shaco** junglers, then you'll receive an S class rank. You didn't get an S class rank that game because other **Shaco** junglers got better scores, which meant your score wasn't quite good enough for the S class percentage.

To be clear, **Yasuo** was competing against other **Yasuos** and you were competing against other **Shacos** to get your S class ranks. 

The stats he needed to get S class can't be compared to yours because you're on different champions.

If an **Urgot** goes 3/0/5 with decent CS, he might get into the S class percentage because most players will feed on **Urgot**. Now if a champion like **Jinx** got that score, she might only get an A because it's quite common for **Jinx** to do better than that.

__*

I'll be fair though, I have noticed myself that CS seems a little over valued. CSing on junglers seems to get me a better score than ganking, in my experience.

I'd say the best thing to do here is to keep **Riot** pressed on the issues. We had a similar issue for support S ranks and it got fixed like that :D

I have received S class as shaco before. The problem I am having here is not "how well I did compared to other shaco's".
The problem is how RIOT's system JUDGES WHAT IS GOOD shaco playing.

Riot's system takes CS, Kills, Deaths, Assists, and objectives into account, but this doesn't work for shaco if you have a perfect game with him.

Does the system take into account how long the game was? 
Or does it take my 20 minute game with 10 kills, and compare it to another shaco's 40 minute game with 20 kills, and say they played better because they got 20 kills?
Do you see the dilema here?
On average, I got a kill every 2 mins. If i was in a 50 minute game, that would equate to 25 kills.

Problem is, the enemy surrendered, BECAUSE I was doing really well, and the game got cut short, apparently meaning I played worse than the average S class Shaco.

We have no idea what **Riot** actually uses for the champion mastery score past KDA and CS. 

They might infact take all those things you said into account, or they might take none of them into account like you claim. All **Riot** has said is that they use a "series of performance metrics".

I'm not too sure where you read that they didn't consider those metrics, but the reality is that no one knows. Personally I've noticed they do account for shorter games etc. (atleast on support), but that's just my experience.

I didnt read that they didn't consider those metrics.
This experience however, suggests it, or at the very least, something has been left out of the equasion.

Here's the way I see it:

Game 1:
This game, I got 10/0/4, and forced a surrender. 1 kill every 2 mins. with one lane gank every 3 mins.
The game ended at 20 mins.
Its pretty damn hard to do better than that, within a 20 min time frame... to increase my score, I'd have to take cs from lanes, which I'd get flamed for before during lane phase.
This earned me an A Grade.

Game 2:
This game, I went 18/3/4. Slightly less kills per min. Ganks were similar, but slightly less.
Objectives were more, because there was more time to get them. 
CS was more, because lane phase was over, and i could split push.
The game ended at 45 mins.
This was enough to earn me an S.

This strongly suggests, that even though I played better in game 1, compared to game 2, I got a lower score purely because the game didnt go for as long.
It strongly suggests that it doesnt weigh your performance against the gaming time played.
Something is obviously missing from the equasion.

Hmm, your statistics are a pretty interesting start, but of course the sample size is very low with only 2 games.  I'd suggest collecting a few more as you play (around 10-20), then making a post about it here to incite some awareness and possibly action.
Lets be honest. He shouldn't have to do Riot's job.

If he wants to make change should :)

I don't know what statistics **Riot** has, but they seem to think the system is working pretty well. It's the job of a caring dedicated player to say _"hey no, actually this isn't working right at all, this is why..."_.
